Я начал инрать в эту игру еще когда был в начальной школе. Еще в ту в очень старую версию с одинаковыми скинами теров и кт. Даже инете не было и я играл в неё с ботами. Ставил 15 на 15 и понеслась! С тех пор я играю в неё. В cs 1.6 я не играл, а сел сразу за эту поэтому сравнивать немогу что лучше. Но в steam я её купил совсем недавно. Поиграйте на zombe escape моде в ней. Я думаю вам понрався. Много разных атмосферных карт, которые нужно пройти кт(люди), притом чтобы их не сожрали зомби(теры). Там играю и я public нажоел. Вообщем игра Супер!!!

If I were you I would get Counter-Strike: Source A.S.A.P; epesialy the fact that this game is one of the three most essential games in another game in particular which would happen to be Garry's Mod.  Just for these two reasons that just the game itself is just flat out 100/10 the bots are great in this and the online play is fun as heck as well.  ;D

Ahh yes, the tale as old as time itself. I still remember 11-year-old me practically begging my parents to get me this game when it came out. Good times. It's not entirely what I remember, but hey, I still have a lot of fun playing it.

CS:S is a wonderful FPS. Anyone who enjoys CS:GO or CS should get this game. Of course this game plays differently from both of those so it will take a bit of time to get used to its feel. CS:S is probably the best FPS ever in my opinion. CS:GO is way more competitive and attracts a bigger audience. To new players, CS is no easy game. It will take atleast 40 hours of gameplay to get anywhere. CS:S is a fun fast paced FPS and I think everyone on steam should have this game. 

Oh... And one more thing, Dont just buy this game for Gary's Mod Textures. PLEASE!!!!

Counter-Strike: Source is the Source engine remake of the original Counter-Strike released officially by Valve in November of 2004. This game is basically a complete graphical makeover of the original Counter-Strike which ran on the GoldSrc engine back in the day. The modelling is still pretty good even by today’s standard and the graphics certainly aged well on some of the official Valve maps such as Dust 2 and Office. This game is strictly multiplayer and doesn’t have any official servers like Counter-Strike: Global Offensive so expect players with bad behaviour and a relatively good amount of spawn camping. I also wouldn’t recommend playing this game unless you are directly connected to internet via Ethernet cable unless you can play wirelessly really fast. I say that because a lot of people in this game are a******* so expect to be voted off the server if you lag during a knife fight or something like that (such BS). You also have many weapons to choose from just like the CS 1.6 and the rules of the game haven’t changed at all so it plays just like the original CS 1.6. Also some of the maps these servers choose are just a cluster f***! Some servers are so damn full that I lag a bit and I get spawn raped before even moving. Personally I’m not a big fan of online gaming but this is probably the only decent one that I’ve played so please buy this if you can get it on sale or something.

Counter-Strike Source is a very good shooter - however I would not agree with anyone who says that it is better than Global Offensive. It is still a very good way to have fun and get constantly destroyed by 14-year-old Finnish aimbots online, though and I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys that kind of stuff, and also needs some skins for Garry's Mod.
Nice
Обожаю Эту Игру!

If I had to describe Counter Strike: Source in one word it would be communal. This game is a classic but it has aged well. The community is the best part. After CS:GO came out, all the little kids and Russians emigrated from CS:S to its "superior" successor. There aren't too many servers out there which means that you will find people who are dedicated to just one server. This creates a beautiful community for each server. Sure, it might not be as "pretty" as CS:GO, but the social aspect of the servers more than makes up for that.
